This adds new variable 'action' for release payload that includes type of the release: [github docs](https://docs.github.com/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhooks/webhook-events-and-payloads?actionType=released#release)

Fixes #5518

This is possibly a breaking change if some repositories relied on different workflows?

title: build(deps): bump apollo-server-express from 3.10.3 to 3.11.1

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update Javascript code

body:
Bumps [apollo-server-express](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-server/tree/HEAD/packages/apollo-server-express) from 3.10.3 to 3.11.1.
Changelog

Sourced from apollo-server-express's changelog.

v3.11.1

  • apollo-server-core: Follow-up to v3.11.0: make GraphQLRequestContext.requestIsBatched optional for better compatibility with older versions of @apollo/gateway.

v3.11.0

  • ⚠️ SECURITY: The cache control plugin no longer sets the cache-control HTTP response header if the operation is part of a batched HTTP request. Previously, it would set the header to a value describing the cache policy of only one of the operations in the request, which could lead to data being unintentionally cached by proxies or clients. This bug was introduced in v3.0.0 and this fix restores the behavior of Apollo Server 2. (In Apollo Server 4 (specifically, @apollo/server@4.1.0 or newer), the features work properly together, setting the header based on the combined cache policy of all operations.) This could theoretically have led to data tagged as uncacheable being cached and potentially served to different users. More details are available at the security advisory.
  • apollo-server-core: New field GraphQLRequestContext.requestIsBatched available to plugins.

v3.10.4

  • apollo-server-core: Manage memory more efficiently in the usage reporting plugin by allowing large objects to be garbage collected more quickly. [PR #7106](apollographql/apollo-server#7106)
  • apollo-server-core: The usage reporting plugin now defaults to a 30 second timeout for each attempt to send reports to Apollo Server instead of no timeout; the timeout can be adjusted with the new requestTimeoutMs option to ApolloServerPluginUsageReporting. (Apollo's servers already enforced a 30 second timeout, so this is unlikely to break any existing use cases.) [PR #7106](apollographql/apollo-server#7106)

title: Improve monoimage by removing unnecessary files and fixing RUN commands
body:
* tidy-up `.dockerignore` file to add few more entries that don't belong in resulting monoimage
* install dependencies for `clients/client` to match the expected behavior from other workflows
* fixes issue with `rm -rf` that used bash expansion which doesn't work since RUN doesn't use bash

title: Lint all the generic-worker engines, not just multiuser
body: Simple update to lint tests to make sure all generic-worker engines are linted, not just multiuser engine.

title: Better handling of preinstall script inside docker
fix(cloudbuild): add `--ignore-scripts` flag to yarn install to skip preinstall
body:
Cloudbuild starting [failing](https://github.com/taskcluster/taskcluster/runs/10259231223) after https://github.com/taskcluster/taskcluster/pull/5920 landed.

Adding in [this flag](https://classic.yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/install#yarn-install---ignore-scripts-) will skip the new, `preinstall` script.

Example of it running with and without the flag:

```bash
➜  taskcluster git:(main) yarn                 
yarn install v1.22.19
$ cd clients/client && yarn --frozen-lockfile
yarn install v1.22.19
[1/5] 🔍  Validating package.json...
[2/5] 🔍  Resolving packages...
success Already up-to-date.
✨  Done in 0.06s.
[1/5] 🔍  Validating package.json...
[2/5] 🔍  Resolving packages...
[3/5] 🚚  Fetching packages...
[4/5] 🔗  Linking dependencies...
[5/5] 🔨  Building fresh packages...

✨  Done in 1.92s.
➜  taskcluster git:(main) yarn --ignore-scripts
yarn install v1.22.19
[1/5] 🔍  Validating package.json...
[2/5] 🔍  Resolving packages...
[3/5] 🚚  Fetching packages...
[4/5] 🔗  Linking dependencies...
[5/5] 🔨  Building fresh packages...
warning Ignored scripts due to flag.
✨  Done in 1.31s.
```

title: Add preinstall hook to avoid having inconsistent installs.
body:
This happens because taskcluster-client is linking clients/client package which is not private. And "link:" dependencies work on the "private":true packages.
Yarn is not supposed to install all such dependencies of the linked packages, and in some conditions fails with ENOENT error.

Bumps [jsonwebtoken](https://github.com/auth0/node-jsonwebtoken) from 8.5.1 to 9.0.0.
Changelog

Sourced from jsonwebtoken's changelog.

9.0.0 - 2022-12-21

Breaking changes: See Migration from v8 to v9

Breaking changes

  • Removed support for Node versions 11 and below.
  • The verify() function no longer accepts unsigned tokens by default. ([834503079514b72264fd13023a3b8d648afd6a16]https://github.com/auth0/node-jsonwebtoken/commit/834503079514b72264fd13023a3b8d648afd6a16)
  • RSA key size must be 2048 bits or greater. ([ecdf6cc6073ea13a7e71df5fad043550f08d0fa6]https://github.com/auth0/node-jsonwebtoken/commit/ecdf6cc6073ea13a7e71df5fad043550f08d0fa6)
  • Key types must be valid for the signing / verification algorithm

Security fixes

  • security: fixes Arbitrary File Write via verify function - CVE-2022-23529
  • security: fixes Insecure default algorithm in jwt.verify() could lead to signature validation bypass - CVE-2022-23540
  • security: fixes Insecure implementation of key retrieval function could lead to Forgeable Public/Private Tokens from RSA to HMAC - CVE-2022-23541
  • security: fixes Unrestricted key type could lead to legacy keys usage - CVE-2022-23539

title: build(deps): upgrade node to 16.19.0
body: >Upgrades to latest `lts/gallium` Node version, v16.19.0

title: build(deps): major version bumps using `pmac` tool
body:
>Upgrade some major version dependency bumps using `pmac` tool:
>
>`pmac add 5748 5811 5902 5903`

If you look into each of the 4 PRs I've combined (#5748 #5811 #5902 #5903), you'll see my comment as to why it should be fine to merge (typically just dropped support for old versions of Node.js).

title: UI static asset caching and 404 response
body:
* Adds client cache header for static assets to avoid downloading same big files over and over.
* Adds 404 status responses for all `/api/*` and `/graphql` routes since they are not part of the UI service, but due to the UI being default backend in k8s it sometimes accepts calls for non-existing `/api/*` endpoints but  returns 200 as SPA serves everything from `index.html` 
* local docker-compose serves both public and private buckets

title: fix(changelog): don't require changelog on dep upgrades
body: This will fix it so that `meta-changelog-pr` tasks in `client-rust` and `taskgraph` dependency upgrades won't fail like they are in https://github.com/taskcluster/taskcluster/pull/5904 and https://github.com/taskcluster/taskcluster/pull/5908.

body:
Bumps [taskcluster](https://github.com/taskcluster/taskcluster) from 46.1.0 to 46.1.1.
Release notes

Sourced from taskcluster's releases.

v46.1.1

GENERAL

▶ [patch] #5844 Filter debug logging information for failed registerWorker calls.

▶ [patch] #5890 Fix provisioners endpoint returning non-unique workers for the queue view.

▶ [patch] #5851 Improve error reporting for github api calls.

▶ [patch] Minor and patch version bumps via Dependabot using pmac:

pmac add 5887 5881 5880 5879 5878 5876 5874 5873 5872

DEVELOPERS

▶ [patch] The Rust client now correctly base64-encodes ext hawk values with the STANDARD alphabet instead of URL_SAFE. This may fix intermittent generation of invalid temporary credentials.

▶ [patch] This patch makes it so the taskcluster shell client (cli) is built with goreleaser.

goreleaser also will automatically keep our homebrew-tap formula up-to-date during the release process.

GitHub releases will now also contain zipped Windows executables of this cli supporting both amd64 and arm64. arm64 binaries for linux have been added as well.

The darwin and linux binaries are now tarballs.

Changelog

Sourced from taskcluster's changelog.

v46.1.1

GENERAL

▶ [patch] #5844 Filter debug logging information for failed registerWorker calls.

▶ [patch] #5890 Fix provisioners endpoint returning non-unique workers for the queue view.

▶ [patch] #5851 Improve error reporting for github api calls.

▶ [patch] Minor and patch version bumps via Dependabot using pmac:

pmac add 5887 5881 5880 5879 5878 5876 5874 5873 5872

DEVELOPERS

▶ [patch] The Rust client now correctly base64-encodes ext hawk values with the STANDARD alphabet instead of URL_SAFE. This may fix intermittent generation of invalid temporary credentials.

▶ [patch] This patch makes it so the taskcluster shell client (cli) is built with goreleaser.

goreleaser also will automatically keep our homebrew-tap formula up-to-date during the release process.

GitHub releases will now also contain zipped Windows executables of this cli supporting both amd64 and arm64. arm64 binaries for linux have been added as well.

The darwin and linux binaries are now tarballs.

> Minor and patch version bumps via Dependabot using `pmac`:
>

title: Remove duplicate workers from queue view.
body:
This change ensures that only unique workers are being returned.

Problem: fetching workers for the queue view returned non-unique workers, i.e. same static worker that was assigned to two different worker_pool_id.

Fixes #5890

However, I'm not sure if this should be allowed in the first place.
On community we happen to have same static worker which is assigned to two different worker pools.
Maybe this is a valid scenario where worker can serve both queues?

title: feat(cli): build taskcluster cli with goreleaser
body:
This fixes https://github.com/taskcluster/homebrew-tap/issues/2.

> This patch makes it so the taskcluster shell client (cli) is built with `goreleaser`.
>
> `goreleaser` also will automatically keep our [homebrew-tap](https://github.com/taskcluster/homebrew-tap/blob/main/Formula/taskcluster.rb) formula up-to-date during the release process.
>
> GitHub releases will now also contain zipped Windows executables of this cli supporting both amd64 and arm64. arm64 binaries for linux have been added as well.
>
> The darwin and linux binaries are now tarballs.

Followed https://goreleaser.com/customization/homebrew/ as well as many of their other docs.

This tool is incredibly powerful. We can use it to publish to chocolatey and snap, for example. I think all of our go builds could be migrated over to this. It handles archiving and also can create a checksum file for each file.

title: Go lint updates
body:
Version numbers were hidden inside `workers/generic-worker/build.sh` script so would never get auto-updated. These versions are only for CI lint checks so don't affect release bits of generic-worker, only the lint checks. This keeps them on latest, which is probably a safer bet them pinning them to a version which quickly could outdated without us noticing.

Additionally run the linter against all generic-worker engines, not just multiuser engine. Also reinstated `goimports -w` which was temporarily suppressed.

> Use updated gw-ci-macos-10-14 worker pool.

title: Issue 5836 - build start-worker-windows-386
body:
Github Bug/Issue: Fixes #5836

There were two problems:

1) The bash script `tools/worker-runner/build.sh` that builds Worker Runner executables (executable `start-worker-*`) was not configured to exit in case of a failure (`set -e`).
2) Code inside worker-runner attempted to detect an overflow condition and trigger a runtime panic if it found one. This did not work, did not compile for 32 bit platforms, ~~and also added no value - the go runtime itself would detect such an overflow and trigger a runtime exception. And the runtime exception would probably provide better information than this customised version.~~

Note, at the same time, I cleaned up build.sh a little bit too, as strings were not properly quoted, and the script could not be called from a different working directory to the one it is located in.

title: [ui] Fix typo in TaskRunsCard
Hook last fires pagination
body:
This PR changes:
- `get_last_fires` uses sorting by creation date to avoid doing full scan to find latest
- `hooks_last_fires` table has new index to allow faster ORDER BY + LIMIT queries for time column
- changes graphql that adds pagination to `lastHookFires` to avoid sending everything to the client

Closes: #5804 #5573 #4870

title: ignore workers/generic-worker/downloads
body: This appears to be created by tests..

title: [generic-worker] support uploading object artifacts
body:
This adds support for uploading artifacts containing data as type 'object' instead of type 's3', still defaulting to 's3'.

The PR begins with some refactoring.  The two interesting bits are adding the new object-service support (which is quite simple, since it relies on existing client support for object-service uploads) and using the configuration value to decide whether to create an S3Artifact or ObjectArtifact.

Github Bug/Issue: Fixes #4605
